entry.title: lithophanes (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that porcelain lithophanes (examples pictured) are intended to be viewed when lit from behind?

entry.title: Nestor Binabo (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that when Nestor Binabo's wife was freed by her kidnappers, she was given a bag of fish and told to make her husband peppersoup?

entry.title: Poison Book Project (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the Poison Book Project has identified more than 100 books that contain arsenic?

entry.title: Live at Bush Hall (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that for Live at Bush Hall the band Black Country, New Road created three distinct backstories for its performances, including one about a pizza chef who comes across a poltergeist?

entry.title: Claire von Greyerz (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that the children of papercutting artist Claire von Greyerz received some of their education together with Napoleon III?

entry.title: Ansonia Hotel (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that originally, residents of New York City's Ansonia Hotel received fresh eggs from a farm on its roof?

entry.title: a Lady Gaga song (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that a Lady Gaga song became popular 11 years after its release, when videos showing Jenna Ortega, as Wednesday Addams, dancing to the song became viral on TikTok?

entry.title: Manga Up! (Wikipedia — did you know?)
entry.content: ... that knees and elbows were censored on Manga Up!?
